alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Knott (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:54PM EDT until July 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR MARTIN...SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON...NORTHEASTERN KNOTT...FLOYD AND WESTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 154 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Nero to Alvin to McDowell, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Endicott, Gulnare, Pleasant, Pikeville, Varney and Laura. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
